Description: non-paying bidders please note--if payment/communication is not received within 24 hours it will be presumed the bidder is agreeing to cancel the bid and i will re-list the item as is allowed under ebay rules--bidders with less than 10 positive feedback please contact me before bidding beautiful playing and looking Gibson ES-446 in a rather rare amber sunburst--i've had these in cherry and black and blonde and tobacco burst but this is the first i've seen in this finish--it's reall lovely it's all original including the case and the COA is included and matches the headstock serial number it's in very good condition--it has one small nick on the neck toward the heel--shown--not felt when playing and a ding on the back which is the most visible of the blemishes--i've shown this from a few different angles--not structural just a small ding the heel is solid--the neck angle perfect--the action low and it has new strings a clean and polish and has been intonated and set up for my preferences all prior to sale--i had 12s on this but put 10s on it which is better in my opinion for the blues--the 12s turn it into an excellent jazz guitar which is part of its legend. Most looking probably know but this is a solid spruce top with solid spruce carved bracing so there not glued on which gives it a very unique sound with amazing sustain--the back and neck are solid mahogany -- the body is contoured for easier and longer playing comfort frets are good with lots of life left and the fretboard is also good--the guitar has been played--it belonged to a working musician but it has not been abused in any way--just used for what it was intended to be used for. I'd give it a 7.5--8.0 out of 10 conservatively. no reserve -- starts at a penny--the buy it now is $2600 which is reasonable for a custom shop arts & historic instrument and far less that the asking price on 446s on Reverb and Ebaythanks for looking please ask any questions prior to bidding and i will do my best to answer them--between the scans and the description there are no hidden secrets--i will ship to Europe but please ask for shipping quotes before placing a bid--i'll have to open up your country to accept bids and want to screen this process first shipping is an estimate--if you live on the west coast it might cost less--east coast will cost more but i'll eat the difference and provide a scan of the original receipt upon request--remember that insurance is $2 per $100 of declared value-- i have perfect feedback in over 4500 transactions--all my instruments are completely gone over before i offer them--this one has new strings--a clean and polish and fretboard oiling as well as a setup for my preferences-- thank you for looking--the guitar is also for sale on Reverb as well as locally so this auction may end if sold elsewhere--
Title: Gibson 2000 Custom Shop ES-446 Arts & Historic All Original OHSC & COA
Subtitle: offers considered
ConditionDescription: if an offer is accepted i will re-list the guitar for the offer amount and the buyer will have a few hours to make payment unless someone else sees it and buys it at the offered amount
